description.narrative:
Burundi is facing humanitarian crises resulting from conflicts and natural disasters that sometimes lead to displacement of populations, chronic food insecurity and limited access to basic infrastructure. The climatic hazards that increasingly affect theBurundianpopulation include droughts, floods, high winds, hail, etc. This leads the population to higher levels of risk and humanitarian needs at a time when the capacities to reduce these risks, emergency response and coordination of local actors are still very weak.
However, even if emergency aid is still needed, it is now essential for humanitarian and development actors to work in an integrated and continuous way to strengthen the resilience of local populations, their capacity to absorb, adapt and respond to multiple shocks,reducing the risks and impacts of disasters.
To achieve this, a considerable effort must be made to enhance and strengthen the skills of local actors, as well as their access to financial resources. Because of their knowledge of the local context and their knowledge of risks and vulnerabilities, they are better able to respond quickly, appropriately and efficiently in the event of disasters.
It is in this capacity that RCBIF has prepared this Project proposal in order to be able to implement disaster risk prevention actions aimed at reducing the impacts of disasters resulting from landslides and differential erosion.
Here RCBIF intends to strengthen the capacities of local communities in the analysis and assessment of risks, the implementation of disaster prevention actions such as the tracing of level curves and the planting of fixing trees on the slopes of the slopes. Overall goal Contribute to the protection of the watersheds of the hills cankuzo, Mwiruzi, Busumanyi, Kavumu, Gahoko, Gisuru, Ruyigi and Mwegereza. Specific objectives •Promote the protection of the watersheds of the twelve hill lakes using cash for work approaches • Promote the protection and stabilization of the hillsides of the action zone •Promote the reinforcement of devices for slowing down the speed of runoff

participating-org.narrative: Réseau des confessions religieuses la promotion santé et Bien-être Fam

The Network of Religious Denominations for the Promotion of Health and Integral Well-being of the Family (RCBIF-Burundi/ Urunani NDEMESHABUZIMA) is a national non-profit organization of religious inspiration created in June 2013. Registered under Ministerial Order No. 530/1135 of 07 August 2013 in accordance with the then Act on the Organic Framework of Non-profit Organizations in Burundi, itis made up of four member Churches: The Catholic Church, the Anglican Church, the Pentecost Church and the Islamic Community of Burundi (COMIBU). Its vision is to have religious confessions committed to the promotion of the integral health and well-being of the family. Its mission is to overcome poverty and human suffering by promoting the integral health and well-being of the family and ensuring that everyone is respected and valued. Because of its interfaith nature, the CNBIF has a large audience in communities across the country. Overall, BIFCN’s interventions focus primarily on: - Food security - Emergencies and Resilience - Health/Nutrition, - Peace building and social cohesion These interventions are carried out in 17 of the 18 provinces of Burundi and mainly target pregnant and lactating women, women of reproductive age, children under 5 years of age, young people and adolescents and the most vulnerable and disadvantaged populations. The main partners are the Government of Burundi, World Vision Burundi, European Union, Christian Aid, GIZ/Health Sector and PSI.
